title: As a Club user I want to be prevented from initiating a MJ Offseason Assignment transaction for a player that does not belong to my Club
custom_preconds:
See Business Rule #15.02: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/15.+MJ+Offseason+Assignment

See Error Message #66: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Major+Assignments+-+Error+Messages

Acceptance Criteria:
* Selecting "Offseason Assignment" on the MJ Create New menu for a player from their Player History will check to see if the player's Current Org is set to the Org of the initiating user. 
* If the Org of the initiating user is BOC, then they should be allowed to create the transaction.
* If the Org of the initiating user is not BOC or the Current Org of the player, then display a blocking message.
**Message**
**Body:** "You do not have permission to create a transaction for a player that belongs to another Organization."
**Hint Text:**"If you believe you have received this message in error, please contact the BOC."  
**Button(s):** Back
* Clicking Back will return the user to the Player History.

title: As a user I want to receive an error if the player I'm attempting to create a MJ Offseason Assignment for is a MN League Player
custom_preconds:
Given User is creating MJ offseason Assignment transaction for MN league player
See Business Rule #15.01: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/15.+MJ+Offseason+Assignment

See Error Message #17: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Major+Assignments+-+Error+Messages
custom_steps: Selecting a MN player > click MJ > Assignment > Offseason Assignment
custom_expected: * If the player's pending roster status is at the minor league level, then the user will receive an error. See Messages #17.

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new Offseason Assignment transaction for a MJ player
custom_preconds:
See Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Offseason+Assignment

See Wireframe: 
http://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=offseason_assignment

GIVEN user is logged in as a club
custom_steps:
WHEN I navigate to a pro player profile
AND click Create New
custom_expected:
THEN "Assignments" should be an option under Major Transactions.
AND "Offseason Assignment" should be an option in the fourth level dropdown
AND Selecting "Offseason Assignment" from the Create New will check to see if there is an existing Preliminary Offseason Assignment transaction for the same player created within 10 days of the current date. 
AND If a preliminary offseason assignment already exists, the system will load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction. 
AND If no preliminary offseason assignment transaction created within the last 10 days already exists, then the system will load a new Preliminary transaction in edit mode. 
AND Transaction should follow the wireframe and data discovery.

title: As a user I want to be able to Cancel creation of or changes to a MJ Offseason Assignment transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
AND is viewing an off season assignment in edit mode
custom_expected:
THE this will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made. 
AND If they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction. 
AND If they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded in the default mode (view/edit) for the current transaction state, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected.
AND If they do not confirm the cancellation then the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.

title: As a user I want to save a MJ Offseason Assignment transaction for a player
custom_preconds:
See Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Offseason+Assignment

Acceptance Criteria:
* A Save button will be available anytime the form is in edit mode. 
* Clicking Save will save the transaction and it's current values.
* Transaction status will be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status will not change.  
* After a successful save the system will display a successful save blue notification. See Messages #18.

title: As a user I want to view an existing MJ Offseason Assignment transaction
custom_preconds:
See Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Offseason+Assignment

See Wireframe: 
http://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=offseason_assignment

GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
AND there is an Offseason Assignment in the system
custom_steps:
WHEN the user conducts and Advanced Search
AND uses the filters Transaction Type > Is > Offseason Assignment
custom_expected:
THEN Clicking on the transaction in a player's Player History or Advanced Search will open the transaction in the same window. 
AND The layout of the transaction will match the View mode of the provided wireframe.
AND Fields will match the provided data discovery.
AND Whenever the form is in view mode, the user will see a "Close" button on the form in grey. 
AND Clicking "Close" will return the user to their entry point into the transaction.

title: As a user I want to edit an existing MJ Offseason Assignment transaction for a player
custom_preconds:
See Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Offseason+Assignment

See Wireframe: 
http://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=offseason_assignment

Acceptance Criteria:
* An Edit button will be available anytime the form is in view mode if the viewing user has edit permissions for the form in its current state. 
* Clicking  Edit will reload the form in edit mode, and a Save button will appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode). 
* In Preliminary, the Club and BOC users will be able to edit all portions displayed on the form.
* Edit only gives clubs access to attach new files in any state other than Preliminary. Club cannot edit existing attachments or any other part of transaction.
* BOC is able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions. 
* In Approved and Reversed transactions, edit only gives BOC access to attach new files or edit existing attachments. They can also update "Comments" and "BOC Notes" fields, but they cannot edit any other part of transaction unless specifically stated in data discovery.
* Clicking Save will always reload the form in View mode.

title: As a user I want to be able to delete a MJ Offseason Assignment transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
AND has a  transaction that is still in a Preliminary state
custom_expected:
* Clicking "Delete" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the form from the system.
* If they confirm the deletion, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction. 
* If they do not confirm the deletion, then they should be returned to the form and no action should be taken.

title: As a user I want to approve a MJ Offseason Assignment transaction
custom_preconds:
See Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Offseason+Assignment

See Approval Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/15.+MJ+Offseason+Assignment

Acceptance Criteria:
* Users with edit permissions see an "Approve" button in blue when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in Preliminary states. 
* Clicking "Approve" will run all required field, formatting and On Approve rules checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
* Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
* If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
* A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved.
* Update Player's Player History: Code =OFFSA Description = Offseason Assignment to *insert offseason league selection here* , From Org/Club and To Org/Club fields in black font.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reverse a MJ Offseason Assignment transaction
custom_preconds:
See Reverse Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/15.+MJ+Offseason+Assignment

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Major+Assignments+-+Error+Messages

Acceptance Criteria:
Reverse:
* BOC Approvers see a "Reverse" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in the Approved state. 
* Clicking "Reverse" will run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. On Submit rules are not run. 
* Successful reverse notification will be displayed. See Messages #70
* The transaction status is updated to "Reversed"
* Display reversed transaction in player history with â€œVoided:â€￾ in front of the transaction description. Example:â€￾ Voided: Selection to ML Rosterâ€￾ 

Suppress:
* Users that have permission to suppress the form will see a "Reverse and Suppress" option on Approved transactions and a "Suppress" button on Reversed transactions, both in grey, in either view or edit mode. 
* Clicking "Reverse and Suppress" will first reverse, and then suppress the transaction. Reverse is handled in a previous story so this story will only deal with the suppression. 
* Clicking "Suppress" will suppress the transaction.
* When a transaction is suppressed it will be hidden from the player's Player History, Searches (unless BOC user specifically searches suppressed transactions), and any other place where it is visible on UI.
* Suppressing a transaction will also remove any notifications that were generated for the transaction prior to suppression.
*A blue notification should be thrown saying "The transaction has been successfully suppressed"

title: As a Club user I want to receive a notification when a MJ offseason assignment is approved or reversed
custom_preconds:
Given user is logged in as a club 

See Clipboard Rules (#1, #3): 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/MJA+Notifications
custom_steps: Has a MJ offseason assignment transaction (Approved or Reversed)
custom_expected:
* Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Approved. 
* Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Reversed, unless the transaction is also Suppressed. 
* "Description" will be a hyperlink.
* Clicking on the description hyperlink of any of these notifications will open the MJ Offseason Assignment transaction in view mode in the same window/tab. 
* Player's name will be a hyperlink.
* Clicking on the player's name hyperlink of any of these notifications will open the player's profile in view mode in the same window/tab on the Player History tab.

title: As a BOC user I want to receive a notification when a MJ offseason or MN offseason assignment is approved
custom_preconds:
See Clipboard Rules (#1): 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/MJA+Notifications

Acceptance Criteria:
* BOC will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Approved. 
* MJ Offseason assignment approval will trigger a notification for the BOC MJ Transactions Super Admin/Admin/Basic roles.
* MN Offseason assignment approval will trigger a notification for the BOC MN Transactions Admin/Basic Roles.
* "Description" will be a hyperlink.
* Clicking on the description hyperlink of any of these notifications will open the transaction in view mode in the same window/tab. 
* Player's name will be a hyperlink.
* Clicking on the player's name hyperlink of any of these notifications will open the player's profile in view mode in the same window/tab on the Player History tab.

title: As a user I want to be able to print a Notice of Disposition for a MJ Offseason Assignment
custom_preconds:
Report Layout: 


Acceptance Criteria:
* Users that have permission to Print from the form (basic or admin rights for the current form for the BOC or From Org) will see a "Print" button on the transaction in view or edit mode. 
* Clicking on Print should open a menu where the user can choose to print a Notice of Disposition. 
* Selecting "Notice of Disposition" will generate a pdf of the Notice of Disposition in English if the language on the player's profile is set to anything other than Spanish. 
* Selecting "Notice of Disposition" will generate a pdf of the Notice of Disposition in Spanish if the language on the player's profile is set to Spanish. 
* The English pdf will follow the English Notice of Disposition format.
* The Spanish pdf will follow the Spanish Notice of Disposition format.

title: MJ Offseason Assignment Permissions - Club - Major Transactions - Admin
custom_preconds:
Roles and Permissions: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/1.+Roles+and+Permissions

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Club users with this role can view and print all major league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs too.
 
      However, there are exceptions:
      1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
      2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field

* Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) major league transactions including other club's Major League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
      1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
      2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
      3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
 
* Can create, delete, submit, edit, attach files, and e-sign all Major League transactions for Major League players on their Org's roster or if they are the"From Org" or "To Org".

title: MJ Offseason Assignment Permissions - Club - Major Transactions - Basic
custom_preconds:
Roles and Permissions: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/1.+Roles+and+Permissions

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Club users with this role can view and print all major league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs too.

          However, there are exceptions:
                  1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
                  2. They cannot edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
                  3. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
 
* Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) major league transactions including other club's Major League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
    1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
    2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
    3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs too.

          However, there are exceptions:
                  1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
                  2. They cannot edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
                  3. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
 
* Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) minor league transactions including other club's Minor League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
    1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
    2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
    3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

title: As a user I want approving a Major/Minor Outright transaction for a player who is currently on Option to auto-recall them
custom_preconds:
MJ/MN Outright Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89349694

Recall Business Rules: 


Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a MJ/MN Outright is approved for a player that is currently Optioned, the system should auto-create and approve a Recall transaction for the player prior to outrighting him. 
* The Recall should be created for the same transaction date for the Outright. 
* The Recall should have the "Recalled for Subsequent Assignment" checkbox checked. 
* The Recall should have the Report Date field empty. 
* The Recall should be processed as normal by the system, and inserted in the player's history prior to the MJ/MN Outright. 
* If for any reason the on submit/on approve rules for the Recall fail for the player, the MJ/MN Outright should also fail and not be approved. The error message for the recall should display for the user.

title: As a user I want to be able to approve an Elect Free Agency XXB transactions for all of the players in the Elect Free Agency widget
custom_preconds:
Wireframe: 
http://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=elect_free_agency_-_xx_b_

Elect Free Agency Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/13.+Elect+Free+Agency


Acceptance Criteria: 
* There should be an Approve button on the widget. 
* Clicking this button will allow the user to enter the election date to be used for all of the current players. 
* After entering the date, the user should have the ability to confirm that they want to elect FA for the # of players in the widget. 
* Confirming will attempt to create and auto-approve an Elect Free Agency transaction for each player that is on the widget that does NOT currently have the "hold" checkmark checked.
* The system will run through the entire population of players before displaying any error messages or confirmation. 
* All of the Elect Free Agency rules will run as usual for each transaction. The Elect Free Agency type will be set to XX(B) for each player, with the election date = the date entered by the user. All regular On Approve updates should be made for the player. 
* Once the last player has been processed, the system will display a confirmation message with the number of players successfully elected, along with a list of the errors encountered. 
* The widget should refresh to only display players who were not successfully processed, as well as any players that were held back.

title: As an EBIS team member I want each environment to indicate which application version (front and back-end) is currently deployed.
custom_preconds:
**Mockup**
 Attached

**AC**
- Show the version info for the front-end and back-end versions of the application via tooltip after the user has logged in.
- The tooltip look and feel should match the provided UX mockup.

**Original Problem**

Currently there is no way for a team member to tell which version of the application is deployed to a given environment - we are reliant on a combination of documentation (Confluence, etc.), regular communication with ops, and our own collective memories. Many web applications have means of displaying the currently deployed version in a manner that does not take up too much room on the screen or otherwise degrade the user experience. We should discuss various methods for displaying version information via the UI, both on the login screen and after a user has logged in, and then choose an approach and implement it.

* Batch run information should display in the batch history widget.

title: As a player, I want to be able to login to the mlb.com/scholarship site
custom_preconds:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Players are able to input the last 4 digits of their National ID number (could be letters or numbers). 
* Players are able to enter their Last Name. The Last Name field should NOT be case sensitive, and it should strip any special characters entered (D'Arnaud becomes darnaud).
* Players are able to enter their Date of Birth. 
* A Login button should appear on the screen and be enabled. 
* Clicking "Login" should check the player's entered credentials against the same information from the list of players who have any CSP or CEP clause in their contract. 
* If the credentials match, then the system should log the player into the system, and take them to the Summary page.

title: As a player, I want to be able to view a summary of my CSP
custom_preconds:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Once a player has logged into the mlb.com/scholarship site, the system should check to see if the player has a CSP or a CEP.
* If they have a CSP, the system will need to determine if they signed before or after 10/3/2004.
* If they signed before 10/3/2004, then the system should display the most up to date CSP Summary for the player. The fields displayed should match the attached screenshot of David Aardsma's summary. 
* If they signed on or after 10/3/2004, then the system should display the most up to date CSP Summary for the player. The fields displayed should match the attached screenshot of Brett Austin's summary. 

*Note that the Payment History at the bottom of the Summary is covered in another story*

  - Check for an existing saved roster for the specified year, roster type and org
     - If no saved roster exists, load existing Post Season Eligibility roster for year and org
     - If no Post Season Eligibility roster exists for the specified year and org, load the 40-man roster for the specified org
 - Load any comments saved with the roster
* Sorted by Last, Roster First. 
* Names displayed as Last, Roster First.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to edit the Draft Order for the upcoming Rule 5 Draft
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://aceshn.axshare.com/#p=draft_order

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When viewing the Draft Order tab, there will be an "Edit" button for those users who have the Draft Order Editor permission. 
* No buttons appear for Viewers.
* Clicking edit will put the screen into Edit mode, per the wireframe.
* The user will have the ability to drag and drop the displayed Orgs into the desired order. 
* Anytime the page is in Edit mode, there is also a Cancel button and a Save button. 
* Clicking "Save" will store the new order, reload the screen in View mode and display a blue successful save notification. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes. If they confirm, the screen will refresh in view mode with no changes stored. If they do not confirm, the popup will close and the user will remain in edit mode with their changes persisting.

title: As a user I want to view end of phase information in the Draft History screen
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://aceshn.axshare.com/#p=draft_history

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Within the Draft History, at the end of each phase there is a "Summary" line. 
* For the end of the MJ phase, the line just contains a summary of all of the players selected in the MJ Phase.
* For the end of the AAA Phase, the line contains a summary of all of the players selected in the AAA phase, as well as the total selected during the entire draft. 
* For the end of the AA Phase, the line contains a summary of all the players selected in the AA phase, as well as the total selected during the entire draft.
*AA is historical only and will not exist moving forward*

title: As a user I want to be able to view the Draft Order for the upcoming Rule 5 Draft
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://aceshn.axshare.com/#p=draft_order

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is a "Rule 5" dashboard visible on the Left Navigation menu. 
* A "Draft Order" tab will be available on the Rule 5 Dashboard. 
* Loading the tab will load the currently stored Draft Order. 
* Default order will be the reverse win order for the current, or most recently concluded season.

title: As a user I want the entire population of players to be loaded into the Selectable Players screen at once

http://aceshn.axshare.com/#p=selectable_players

* The main objective here is speed in finding players.

title: As a user I want to view the Draft History screen
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://aceshn.axshare.com/#p=draft_history

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is a "Draft History" tab available under the "Rule 5 Draft" dashboard.
* Clicking on the "Draft History" tab will load the Draft History. 
* If the draft is NOT in progress, this shows the prior year's Rule 5 Draft by default. 
* The Draft History matches the provided wireframe. 
* Changing the year dropdown at the top will display the selected year's data. 
* The default sort will be descending by overall pick.

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When viewing the Selectable Players screen, there is a "type to filter" entry point on the screen - visible at all times. 
* Typing in this filter box will filter down the Selectable Players screen to only show the rows that contain the text entered into the box (in any column). 
* Erasing the text in this box will return the full population of players, taking into account any of the high level filters applied.

title: As a user I want to be able to apply specific filters to the Selectable Players screen
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://aceshn.axshare.com/#p=selectable_players

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The " All Levels" filter should actually be "All Phases", and the options under that should be: 
 - All Phases 
 - AAA Phase
* Picking AAA Phase should filter out any players that are currently at the AAA level. 
* The "All Positions" filter should be a filter on position and contain a list of all of the player positions in the system. 
* In addition to the header filters, there should also be the capability to apply an "Org" filter and a "Roster Status" filter. 
* The Org filter should filter by the player's current Org. Options should be all 30 Orgs. 
* The Roster Status filter should filter by the player's current Roster status. Options should be a list of all MN Roster Statuses available. 
* Applying any of these filters should work. 
* Clearing any of these filters should return the screen to its full population.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to save the Reserve List counts for the upcoming Rule 5 Draft

* Anytime the page is in Edit mode, there is also a Cancel button and a Save button. 
* Clicking "Save" will verify that there is a value entered for each Club on the screen.
* Once the required field check has passed, the screen will reload in View mode and display a blue successful save notification.
* The system will store the updated reserve counts as the starting point for the Rule 5 Draft. 
* If the Roster Counts had previously been stored for the upcoming draft, those are replaced with the newly saved values.
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes. If they confirm, the screen will refresh in view mode with no changes stored. If they do not confirm, the popup will close and the user will remain in edit mode with their changes persisting.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reverse a Rule 5 Selection transaction
custom_preconds:
See Reverse Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Rule+5+Selection

Acceptance Criteria:
Reverse:
* BOC Approvers see a "Reverse" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in the Approved state. 
* Clicking "Reverse" will run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. On Submit rules are not run. 
* Successful reverse notification will be displayed. 
* The transaction status is updated to "Reversed"
* Display reversed transaction in player history with â€œVoided:â€￾ in front of the transaction description. Example:â€￾ Voided: Selection to ML Rosterâ€￾ 

Suppress:
* Users that have permission to suppress the form will see a "Reverse and Suppress" option on Approved transactions and a "Suppress" button on Reversed transactions, both in grey, in either view or edit mode. 
* Clicking "Reverse and Suppress" will first reverse, and then suppress the transaction. Reverse is handled in a previous story so this story will only deal with the suppression. 
* Clicking "Suppress" will suppress the transaction.
* When a transaction is suppressed it will be hidden from the player's Player History, Searches (unless BOC user specifically searches suppressed transactions), and any other place where it is visible on UI.
* Suppressing a transaction will also remove any notifications that were generated for the transaction prior to suppression.
*A blue notification should be thrown saying "The transaction has been successfully suppressed"

title: As a BOC user I want to be stopped if I attempt to reverse a Rule 5 Selection that is not the player's most recent approved transaction
custom_preconds:
See Business Rule: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Rule+5+Selection

Acceptance Criteria:
* Clicking "Reverse" , or "Reverse and Suppress" will check if the current transaction is the most recent approved transaction. 
* If the transaction is not the most recent approved transaction for the player, then the user will receive an error message. 
**Message** "Only the player's latest approved transaction can be reversed."
* User will ONLY have the back option. Clicking Back will close the modal and return the user to the transaction.

* Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"

title: Rule 5 Selection Permissions - Club - Minor Transactions - Basic
custom_preconds:
Roles and Permissions: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/1.+Roles+and+Permissions

*Note that these are the global permissions rules - for R5 Selections only "Approved" and "Reversed" or "Reversed and Suppressed" state rules will be valid*

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Club users with this role can view and print all minor league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs to.

          However, there are exceptions:
                  1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
                  2. They cannot edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
                  3. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
 
* Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) minor league transactions including other club's Minor League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
    1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
    2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
    3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

title: Rule 5 Selection Permissions - Club - Minor Transactions - Admin
custom_preconds:
Roles and Permissions: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/1.+Roles+and+Permissions

*Note that these are the global permissions rules - for R5 Selections only "Approved" and "Reversed" or "Reversed and Suppressed" state rules will be valid*

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Club users with this role can view and print all minor league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs too.
 
      However, there are exceptions:
      1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
      2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field

* Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) minor league transactions including other club's Minor League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
      1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
      2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
      3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
 
* Can create, delete, submit, edit, attach files, and e-sign all Minor League transactions for Minor League players on their Org's roster or if they are the"From Org" or "To Org".

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new Voluntary Designation transaction for a MN player
custom_preconds:
See Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Voluntary+Designation+-+Data+Discovery

See Wireframe: 
http://aceshn.axshare.com/#p=voluntary_designation

Acceptance Criteria:
* There will be a "Create New" button on the Player History widget for all players. (permissions handled later)
* "Transactions" is an option in the top-level dropdown (already built)
* "Major" and "Minor" radio buttons should now be active, and selecting "Minor" will limit the third and fourth levels to only Minor items (based on whatever was selected in the first dropdown). 
* "Assignments" should be an option under Minor Transactions.
* "Voluntary Designation" should be an option in the fourth level dropdown.
* Selecting "Voluntary Designation" from the Create New will check to see if there is an existing Preliminary Voluntary Designation transaction for the same player created within 10 days of the current date. 
* If a preliminary voluntary designation already exists, the system will load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction. 
* If no preliminary voluntary designation transaction created within the last 10 days already exists, then the system will load a new Preliminary transaction in edit mode. 
* Transaction should follow the wireframe and data discovery.

title: As a user I want to save a Voluntary Designation for a player
custom_preconds:
See Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Voluntary+Designation+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria:
* A Save button will be available anytime the form is in edit mode. 
* Clicking Save will save the transaction and it's current values.
* Transaction status will be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status will not change.  
* After a successful save the system will display a successful save blue notification.

title: As a user I want to be able to Cancel creation of or changes to a Voluntary Designation transaction
custom_preconds:
Acceptance Criteria:
* Whenever the form is in edit mode, the user will see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made. 
* If they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction. 
* If they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded in the default mode (view/edit) for the current transaction state, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected.
* If they do not confirm the cancellation then the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.

title: As a BOC user I want to reject a Voluntary Designation transaction
custom_preconds:
See Rejection Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/15.+Voluntary+Designation

Acceptance Criteria:
* BOC users with edit permissions see a "Reject" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in a Submitted to BOC state. 
* Clicking "Reject" will run all required field, and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
* The transaction status is updated to "Rejected"
* If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
* A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was rejected.
* The item is removed from the player's history. 
* The Approvals item is removed for the BOC.

title: As a user I want to be able to delete a Voluntary Designation transaction
custom_preconds:
Acceptance Criteria:
* Users that have edit permissions for the form in Preliminary or Rejected states will see a "Delete" button on the form in grey, in either view or edit mode. 
* Clicking "Delete" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the form from the system.
**Title:** Warning
**Body:** Are you sure you want to delete this [form]? ("Form" to be replaced with transaction type)
**Hint:** This is a permanent action that cannot be undone.
**Buttons:** Yes, No
* If they confirm the deletion, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction. 
* If they do not confirm the deletion, then they should be returned to the form and no action should be taken.

title: As a Club user I want to receive a notification when a Voluntary Designation is rejected, approved or reversed
custom_preconds:

https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Minor+Assignments+-+Clipboard

Acceptance Criteria:
* Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Approved. 
* Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Rejected.
* Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Reversed, unless the transaction is also Suppressed. 
* "Description" will be a hyperlink.
* Clicking on the description hyperlink of any of these notifications will open the transaction in view mode in the same window/tab. 
* Player's name will be a hyperlink.
* Clicking on the player's name hyperlink of any of these notifications will open the player's profile in view mode in the same window/tab on the Player History tab.

title: As a user I want to receive an error if the player I'm attempting to create a Voluntary Designation for is a MJ League Player
custom_preconds:
See Business Rule #15.02: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/15.+Voluntary+Designation

See Error Message #6: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Minor+Assignments+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria:
* Selecting "Voluntary Designation" from the Minor Assignments Create New menu will check that the player's Pending Roster Status is at the minor league level.
* If the player's pending roster status is at the major league level, then the user will receive an error. See Messages #6. 
* If the player does not have a pending roster status, then the current roster status is used.

title: As a Club user I want to be prevented from initiating a Voluntary Designation transaction for a player that does not belong to my Club
custom_preconds:
See Business Rule #14.03: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/15.+Voluntary+Designation

See Error Message #41: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Minor+Assignments+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria:
* Selecting "Voluntary Designation" on the MN Create New menu for a player from their Player History will check to see if the player's Current Org is set to the Org of the initiating user. 
* If the Org of the initiating user is BOC, then they should be allowed to create the transaction.
* If the Org of the initiating user is not BOC or the Current Org of the player, then display a blocking message.
**Message**
**Body:** "You do not have permission to create a transaction for a player that belongs to another Organization."
**Hint Text:**"If you believe you have received this message in error, please contact the BOC."  
**Button(s):** Back
* Clicking Back will return the user to the Player History.

* An Edit button will be available anytime the form is in view mode if the viewing user has edit permissions for the form in its current state.
* Clicking Edit will reload the form in edit mode, and a Save button will appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode).
* In Preliminary, the Club and BOC users will be able to edit all portions displayed on the form. 
* In states other than Preliminary, edit only gives clubs access to attach new files. Club cannot edit existing attachments or any other part of transaction.
* BOC is able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions.
* In Approved and Reversed transactions, edit only gives BOC access to attach new files or edit existing attachments. They can also update "Comments" and "BOC Notes" fields, but they cannot edit any other part of transaction unless specifically stated in data discovery.
* Clicking Save will always reload the form in View mode.

title: As a user I want to submit a Voluntary Designation transaction for a player
custom_preconds:
See Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Voluntary+Designation+-+Data+Discovery

On Submit Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/15.+Voluntary+Designation

Acceptance Criteria:
* A Submit button will be available anytime the form is in a Preliminary or Rejected state. It will be blue for Club users, and grey for the BOC.  
* Clicking Submit will run a required field and formatting check, as well as all on Submit rules. Once the rule checks have been passed or overridden, the system will save the transaction and its current values.
* Transaction status will be set to "Submitted to BOC".
* After a successful submission the system will display a successful submit blue notification. 
* An approvals item will be generated for the BOC. 
* The transaction is added to the Player's History in green font: Code =VLDES Description = Voluntary Designation , From Org/Club fields

title: As a BOC user I want to approve a Voluntary Designation transaction
custom_preconds:
See Approval Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/15.+Voluntary+Designation

Acceptance Criteria:
* BOC users with edit permissions see an "Approve" button in blue when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in Preliminary and Submitted states. 
* Clicking "Approve" will run all required field, formatting, On Submit and On Approve rules checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
* Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
* If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
* A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved.
* Update Player's Player History: Code =VLDES Description = Voluntary Designation , From Org/Club fields in black font.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reverse a Voluntary Designation transaction
custom_preconds:
See Reverse Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Rule+5+Selection

Acceptance Criteria:
Reverse:
* BOC Approvers see a "Reverse" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in the Approved state. 
* Clicking "Reverse" will run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. On Submit rules are not run. 
* Successful reverse notification will be displayed. 
* The transaction status is updated to "Reversed"
* Display reversed transaction in player history with â€œVoided:â€￾ in front of the transaction description. Example:â€￾ Voided: Selection to ML Rosterâ€￾ 

Suppress:
* Users that have permission to suppress the form will see a "Reverse and Suppress" option on Approved transactions and a "Suppress" button on Reversed transactions, both in grey, in either view or edit mode. 
* Clicking "Reverse and Suppress" will first reverse, and then suppress the transaction. Reverse is handled in a previous story so this story will only deal with the suppression. 
* Clicking "Suppress" will suppress the transaction.
* When a transaction is suppressed it will be hidden from the player's Player History, Searches (unless BOC user specifically searches suppressed transactions), and any other place where it is visible on UI.
* Suppressing a transaction will also remove any notifications that were generated for the transaction prior to suppression.
*A blue notification should be thrown saying "The transaction has been successfully suppressed"

title: Voluntary Designation Permissions - BOC - Minor Transactions - Basic
custom_preconds:
Roles and Permissions: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/1.+Roles+and+Permissions

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Can view and Print all minor league transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for Minor League Players but cannot make any changes or e-sign.
* Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.

title: Voluntary Designation Permissions - Club - Minor Transactions - Basic
custom_preconds:
Roles and Permissions: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/1.+Roles+and+Permissions

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Club users with this role can view and print all minor league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs to.

          However, there are exceptions:
                  1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
                  2. They cannot edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
                  3. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
 
* Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) minor league transactions including other club's Minor League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
    1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
    2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
    3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

Roles and Permissions: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/1.+Roles+and+Permissions

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Club users with this role can view and print all minor league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs too.
 
      However, there are exceptions:
      1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
      2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field

* Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) minor league transactions including other club's Minor League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
      1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
      2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
      3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
 
* Can create, delete, submit, edit, attach files, and e-sign all Minor League transactions for Minor League players on their Org's roster or if they are the"From Org" or "To Org".

title: Voluntary Designation Permissions - BOC - Minor Transactions - Admin
custom_preconds:
Roles and Permissions: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/1.+Roles+and+Permissions

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Can view and Print all minor league transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for Minor League Players.
* Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.
* Can create, delete, edit, e-sign and submit all Minor league transactions for Minor League players. 
* Can Approve, Reject, Reverse and Suppress all Minor League transactions and see associated Flags.
